properties.title: PRJ#11133 - Brougham St WW Lateral Repairs
properties.address: Brougham St from Barrington St to Barrie St
properties.publicdescription:
Works will begin with the repairs around the intersection of Brougham St and Spencer St. This section of works are expected to take approximately 7 nights to complete (TMP 1 – 1a) The next section of repairs will be in lane 2 of both the east and west bound lanes of Brougham St, east of Selwyn St. This section of works is expected to take approximately 7 nights to complete (TMP 2 – 2a) The final section of works will be closures of lane 1 for both east and west bound traffic of Brougham St. This section of works will take approximately 7 nights to complete. Excavations in this section of works are expected to be in close proximity to the live lane. As an extra safety precaution, the TMA will be used to shadow all works as they move closer to the live lane. (TMP 3 -3a) All excavations will be hydro excavated to expose the damaged section of pipe. Repairs will be carried out, reinstated to road level, and sealed. All construction materials, plant and TTM equipment will be removed daily at the end of works every morning. All TTM will be deployed and removed with the use of the Generic Moblie closure diagram (SC 205)

enquires 0508 718 719

Roading

OPERATION:
CIR: This project consists of the following operations in various locations within the Edgeware and St Albans Catchments

The gravity wastewater main is the pipe that takes wastewater from private laterals through to the pump station. The existing gravity wastewater pipe has suffered multiple breaks due to the earthquakes and needs to be replaced. To complete the gravity wastewater renewal we need to dig trenches ranging from 1.1-2.5 metres deep. Dewatering, using spears and extraction pumping, will be required to drop the water table in the trenches at all times. Excavation will proceed once the ground is dry, using trench shields. A new PVC (polyvinyl chloride) pipe will be installed, then laterals will be renewed and attached at the private property boundary. There may need to be some excavation done at your boundary.

After replacement of the waste water pipe the carriageway will be reinstated and sealed, road markings will be applied if applicable.

Please note: CCTV and flushing of lines will be required prior to commencement of main works

properties.title: PRJ#11241 Woolston WW Infrastructure
properties.address:
Thistledown Place
Lomond place
St Lukes St
properties.publicdescription:
Thistledown Pl Quadraplex 11/01/2016 – 01/04/2016
These works will be in the cul-de-sac of Thistledown Pl. Road closure will be deployed for any major construction movements and open
trenching for the connection of the proposed lift station to the waste water main.. The work site will be reduced to a shoulder closure or lane
width reduction wherever possible. The eastern footpath that leads into reserve will be blocked for these works, with pedestrians being
directed to the western footpath. (TMP 1)
Lomond Pl Lift station 18/01/2016 – 01/04/2016
These works will be on the southern kerb close to the cul-de-sac of Lomond Pl . Road closure with a priority give way on Clydesdale St will be
deployed for any major construction movements and open trenching for the connection of the proposed lift station to the waste water main..
The work site will be reduced to a priority give way or contra flow wherever possible. The southern footpath will be closed for the duration of
works. (TMP 2&3)

St Lukes St Lift Station 18/01/2016 – 20/03/2016
These works will be between #32 and #42 St Lukes St. A one way system will be established for the duration of works. Direction of one way
system will be eastbound to accommodate for proposed road closure on St Johns St (TMP#31739) These works will be completed before
works on the quadraplex begin. (TMP 4)
St Lukes St Quadraplex 21/03/2016 – 30/06/2016
These works will be east of the corner of St Johns St and St Lukes St outside #108. A one way system will be established for the duration of
works. Direction of one way system will be eastbound to accommodate for proposed road closure on St Johns St (TMP#31739) These works
will be commence once the lift station in TMP 4 is completed. Footpath on the northern kern will be closed for the duration of works ( TMP 5)
All works will involve investigation of the construction area to identify underground services. These areas will then be excavated. In the case
of the lift stations, sheet piling may be installed. Construction of the structures will be carried out under an appropriate TMP, and upon
completion, all excavations in the carriage way will be backfilled reinstated and resurfaced. Any affected kerb, channel, footpaths and berms
will also be reinstated and TTM will be removed.

properties.title: PRJ#11179 -Central City–SW,WW Repair & Lining
properties.address: Various roads within the central city
properties.publicdescription:
Works under generic plans
Storm and waste water repairs.
Spot Repairs
Multiple spot repairs area required. The works will involve CCTV of the damaged line to locate the repair. The location will then be excavated, the damaged spot removed and replaced, and then backfilled and resurfaced. Spot repairs will require up to three days to complete.
Section Repairs
Multiple section repairs are required The works will involve CCTV of the damaged line to locate the repair. The location will then be excavated, the damaged section removed and replaced, and then backfilled and resurfaced. Section repairs will require up to 10 days to complete, 

Lining
Once all spot and section repairs are completed, these mains will then need to be lined. Lining will take place mostly during day time hours between 7am and 5pm or restricted to 9am to 4pm on the higher capacity roads. Lining works will generally require closures over two manholes, one of which is likely to be in the middle of an intersection. TTM for lining works will be deployed and removed daily as needed. Lining contractors may complete up to 3 lines per day, so up to 3 different closures a day may be required

Works under site specific plans
Site specific plans will be added to the TMP as investigation works progress. It is assumed all works carried out under generic plans will not reduce capacity, and that site specific plans will be provided in most other cases as they are identified. These works will also be updated to the FWV when they are submitted for approval. Durations for any site specific plans will be similar those prescribed above.

Note: Any planned generic one way systems will be communicated to CTOC, Signals and ECAN a week before commencement.

properties.publicdescription:
Day Time Construction Activities (Off-Peak Traffic Times):
The following construction activities will take place at off Peak times during day shift operations within the permitted TMP’s submitted:
Survey, general investigation works, locating of services, service diversion works, lighting, maintenance works, work to traffic islands, permanent and temporary pavement works etc.
Pedestrian footpaths will be maintained throughout the works and the STMS will establish and control pedestrian crossings/detours where required.

Night Time Construction Activities:
The following construction activities will take place during the night shift operations within the permitted TMP’s submitted:
